thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS BASKETBALL: Norwood names Amy Lepley as new head coach | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS BASKETBALL: Norwood names Amy Lepley as new head coach | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark | Boston Herald

author: Dan Ventura
title: HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS BASKETBALL: Norwood names Amy Lepley as new head coach | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
Norwood athletic director Jon Longley announced the hiring of Amy Lepley as new girls' varsity basketball coach, replacing Alex DaLuz (now coaching the boys team at Seekonk). Lepley spent the past two seasons as the junior varsity girls' basketball coach at Norwood.
 A multi-sport athlete at Bishop Feehan, Lepley was a Boston Herald All-Scholastic in volleyball and basketball. The 6-foot forward scored 920 points despite missing most of her senior season with a knee injury.
 Lepley would go on to play Holy Cross, graduatiing in 2013. A dean's list student at Holy Cross, Lepley was selected as a team captain during her senior season. She was also recognized as a member of the Patriot League's All-Rookie team in 2010 and second-team All-Conference in 2012 and 2013, respectively.
 Lepley is currently a mathematics teacher at Norwood High School.
 Below is her junior year basketball All-Scholastic write-up:
 Amy Lepley Bishop Feehan - The Shamrocks didnâ€™t earn a 22-1 record on luck; they had help from Amy Lepley. The 6-foot junior guard averaged 22.8 points, 10 rebounds and five assists a game as an EAC All-Star and Sporting News All-America honorable mention. With 898 career points, Lepley helped lead her squad to the Division 2 South semifinals in 2006 and 2007.
